column2: Water put into public water supply: 1990/1 to 2010/11

Since 2003 de-regulation of small abstractions set a threshold of 20 cubic metres per day as the value above which an abstraction licence will be required and now includes previously exempt activities such as dewatering, trickle irrigation and navigation within the licensing system. For further details see text.

column3: Metered water is water measured at the point of delivery to premises.
Unmetered water includes leakage from the distribution system and water used for miscellaneous purposes such as firefighting, sewer
cleaning, water mains flushing and temporary supplies for construction sites.

column1: Source: WSA; WCA; Ofwat (from 1991/2); RERAD (from 1999); NI Water and Scottish Water (From 2003)
